titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette to Burgess Preston
CWG13845

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 3 ; 9 April - 25 May 1864

body.p:
423
May 2 4
Col. Burgess Preston
Com'ding 65th Regt E M
Johnson County; Ky
Colonel.

You are hereby ordered to call out your entire command to serve for the period of thirty days, and report with it for duty to the U.S officer in command at Louisa Ky. A. state mustering officer will be there to muster in your companies --

If any of your command have enlisted for six months under -- the late call, you will not compel them to do service under this order, but require them to report at once to the state agent at the rendezvous mentioned in General Order No 3 from the Adjutant Genl' Office.

As the emergency is equally as great, it is hoped that your men and officers will be equally as as prompt in responding to this call, as Col McKinster
424
of the 68th Regt E M of Lawrence County. was in the call recently made upon them by Col Gallup It being desired to prevent the claims growing out of this service to the US. for payment, you will not require the 3d Lieutenants of companies to respond to this call and be mustered in.

Tho E Bramlette
Govr of Ky
